tit.cmt: Kawanishi Town, Shiki Province→Kawanishi-cho, Shiki Countyに修正しました。

sen.j: 富貴寺（ふきじ）は奈良県磯城郡川西町 (奈良県)にある真言宗豊山派の寺院である。
sen.e: Fuki-ji Temple, located in Kawanishi Town, Shiki Province, Nara Prefecture is a temple that belongs to the Buzan school of the Shingon sect.
Fuki-ji Temple, located in Kawanishi Town, Shiki Province, Nara Prefecture is a temple that belongs to the Buzan school of the Shingon sect.
Fuki-ji Temple, located in Kawanishi-cho, Shiki County, Nara Prefecture is a temple that belongs to the Buzan school of the Shingonshu sect.
sen.cmt: Kawanishi Town, Shiki Province→Kawanishi-cho, Shiki Countyに修正、Shingonshu sectとしました。

sen.j: 平安初期に法隆寺夢殿を再興し、法隆寺の学問振興に力を注いだ道詮（どうせん）が晩年に開いたとされる。
sen.e: It is said to have been founded by Dosen, who revived the Yumedono (Hall of Dreams) of Horyu-ji Temple in the early Heian period and dedicated himself to the promotion of academics at Horyu-ji Temple, in his later years.

It is said to have been founded by Dosen, who revived the Yumedono (Hall of Dreams) of Horyu-ji Temple in the early Heian period and dedicated himself to the promotion of academics at Horyu-ji Temple in his later years.

It is said to have been founded by Dosen, who revived the Yumedono (Hall of Dreams) of Horyu-ji Temple in the early Heian period and dedicated himself to the promotion of academics at Horyu-ji Temple in his later years.

sen.j: 今は壺阪寺の末寺となっているが、無住の寺となっている。
sen.e: It is now a branch temple of Tsubosaka-dera Temple, but has no permanently stationed priest.
It is now a branch temple of Tsubosaka-dera Temple, but has no permanently stationed priest.
It is now a branch temple of Tsubosaka-dera Temple, but has no permanently stationed priest.

sen.j: 本堂（重要文化財）－寄棟造本瓦葺の建物。
sen.e: Hondo (main building) (important cultural property) – Rectangular building with hip-and-gable roofing.
Hondo (main building) (important cultural property) – Rectangular building with hip-and-gable roofing.
Hondo (main building) (important cultural property) – Rectangular building with hip-and-gable roofing.

sen.j: 南北朝時代_(日本)末期の元中5年（1388年）の建立。
sen.e: Built in 1388, at the end of the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
Built in 1388, at the end of the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
Built in 1388, at the end of the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

sen.j: 木造釈迦如来坐像（重要文化財）
sen.e: Wooden seated statue of Shaka Nyorai (important cultural property)
Wooden seated statue of Shaka Nyorai (important cultural property)
Wooden seated statue of Shaka Nyorai (important cultural property)

sen.j: 木造地蔵菩薩立像（重要文化財）
sen.e: Wooden standing statue of Jizo Bosatsu (important cultural property)
Wooden standing statue of Jizo Bosatsu (important cultural property)
Wooden standing statue of Jizo Bosatsu (important cultural property)

sen.j: JR大和路線法隆寺駅下車、徒歩（約3km）
sen.e: Walk (approximately 3km) from JR Yamatoji line Horyuji Station
Walk (approximately 3km) from JR Yamatoji line Horyuji Station
Walk (approximately 3km) from the JR Yamatoji Line Horyuji Station
sen.cmt: the JR Yamatoji Lineとしました。

sen.j: 近鉄橿原線結崎駅下車、徒歩（約3km）
sen.e: Walk (approximately 3km) from Kintetsu Kashihara line Yuzaki Station.
Walk (approximately 3km) from Kintetsu Kashihara line Yuzaki Station.
